name: Religion in the Ancient Greek World
description: A study of the religious cults and forms of worship current in the ancient Greek world. The course will consider religion in the ancient Greek city-states, but attention will also be paid to the so-called 'mystery religions', Greek beliefs about the afterlife, and intellectual reflection on religion in Greek literature. [24L]
prerequisites: Prerequisite for CLA students: CLA204H5/ CLA230H5/ CLA237H5; for RLG students: any pertinent RLG course at the 200+ level.
